mgci.jhdap.shogi

Class Move

  • java.lang.Object
    • mgci.jhdap.shogi.Move

  • public class Move
extends java.lang.Object
    A Class that represents a piece move. Meant to be later used with the legitimate shogi notation (e.g. P-8f or 7六歩), but right now, no Japanese.

    The current format is: [piece symbol][initial position] [modifier][final position][promotion modifier]. For example, moving a Pawn from 9g to 9f would be " P9g-9f", and having a bishop move from 5e to capture a piece at 3g and then promote would be " B5ex3g+".
    Author:
    Jiayin Huang, Dmitry Andreevich Paramonov

    • Field Detail

      • pieceName

        public java.lang.String pieceName
        The name of the piece that was moved.

      • from

        public Tile from
        Where the piece was moved from.

      • to

        public Tile to
        Where the piece was moved to.

      • modifier

        public char modifier
        The modifier for this move. - indicates a normal move. * indicates a drop. x indicates a capture.

      • promoted

        public char promoted
        The modifier for promotion. An empty space indicates no promotion. A + indicates promotion.
